Title: 🎬🖼 🇺🇸 🇺🇦 #BREAKING Trump Considering Ending Support to Ukra...
Description: 🇺🇸 🇺🇦 #BREAKING Trump Considering Ending Support to Ukraine Following Argument with Zelenskiy, Says Official: The War Blog: -Following today’s heated exchange with #Ukraine President Volodymyr #Zelenskiy at the White House, #UnitedStates President Donald #Trump is reportedly considering ending all military aid to Ukraine, according to the Washington Post citing a senior administration official.This comes as the State Department was ordered to terminate support for the restoration of Ukraine’s power grid, according to NBC.Leaders from several European countries have come out to express continued support for Ukraine, such as #Norway, #Sweden, #Finland, #Lithuania, #Latvia, #Estonia, #Poland, #Germany, #France, #Moldova, #Czechia, #Spain, #Netherlands, #Denmark, #Austria, #Romania, #Croatia, #Slovenia, and #Belgium.#Ukraine President Volodymyr #Zelensky was reportedly told to leave the #WhiteHouse following a heated exchange with #UnitedStates President Donald #Trump and Vice President JD #Vance during a meeting at the Oval Office, which ultimately resulted in the anticipated signing of the rare earth minerals deal to be cancelled.Following the exchange, Trump took to Truth Social to post:-We had a very meaningful meeting in the White House today. Much was learned that could never be understood without conversation under such fire and pressure. It’s amazing what comes out through emotion, and I have determined that President Zelenskyy is not ready for Peace if America is involved, because he feels our involvement gives him a big advantage in negotiations. I don’t want advantage, I want PEACE. He disrespected the United States of America in its cherished Oval Office. He can come back when he is ready for Peace.-- Via Instagram.com/the.war.blog---Tees: our-wars-today.teemill.comTelegram: t.me/ourwarstoday More: linktr.ee/ourwarstoday---24/7 LIVE News RSS feed: t.me/ournewsfeedtoday Video is too big

Title: 🖼 🇺🇸💰New U.S. Spending Bill Recap: -The #UnitedStates House o...
Description: 🇺🇸💰New U.S. Spending Bill Recap: -The #UnitedStates House of Representatives narrowly passed a multi-trillion-dollar spending bill backed by President Donald Trump, with a 217-215 vote. ⁠Via Ground News – instagram.com/groundnews ⁠The bill extends tax cuts from Trump’s 2017 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act, which were set to expire, and introduces new reductions, including relief for the State and Local Tax (SALT) deduction, tax breaks for domestic manufacturing, and cuts on income from tips, overtime pay, and Social Security benefits. ⁠⁠Without further offsets, the total cost of #Trump’s tax priorities is projected to fall between $5 trillion and $11 trillion over the next decade, with estimates suggesting it could push federal debt to as high as 149% of GDP by 2035. Approximately $4 trillion of that cost comes from the extension of the 2017 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act.⁠ Trump argues that his tax cuts will not be this costly as they will stimulate economic growth and, as a result, increase government revenue. ⁠⁠The legislation proposes $2 trillion in spending cuts over the next ten years to fund tax reductions along with other aspects of Trump’s agenda, including increased military and immigration enforcement spending. ⁠⁠While the budget does not explicitly mention Medicaid, it directs the House Energy and Commerce Committee to find $880 billion in reductions, potentially affecting eligibility and benefits for the over 20% of #American citizens who rely on the program. Trump assured that -Medicare, Medicaid, none of that stuff is going to be touched,- but critics argue that such deep budget cuts will be difficult to achieve without impacting major social programs. ⁠⁠Democrats opposed the bill, calling it a tax break for the wealthy that could shift financial burdens onto lower-income Americans.⁠⁠With House approval secured, the bill now moves to the Senate, where it must be reconciled with a separate budget proposal. Negotiations between the Senate and House are ongoing, and the compromise bill between the two chambers will likely have major differences from this current House bill.⁠-–Ground News---Tees: our-wars-today.teemill.comTelegram: t.me/ourwarstoday More: linktr.ee/ourwarstoday---24/7 LIVE News RSS feed: t.me/ournewsfeedtoday

Title: 🖼 🇷🇺 🇺🇦 #NEW Russian Federation Vows To Annex Four Ukrainian...
Description: 🇷🇺 🇺🇦 #NEW Russian Federation Vows To Annex Four Ukrainian Territories in Entireties, Despite Peace Deals:Kyiv Post: -#Moscow would not stop at the current contact lines in #Ukraine and sought to capture the entirety of four Ukrainian regions it claimed to have annexed via illegal referendums, according to a Wednesday statement by Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov.-Some say: ‘Okay, let’s leave the line of contact. This is Russian, and this is Ukrainian.’ This will not happen. We have a Constitution based on the will of the people,- Lavrov said at a press conference, referring to Moscow’s illegal referendums in Ukraine.In late 2022, #Russia announced the annexation of Ukraine’s #Donetsk, #Luhansk, #Kherson and #Zaporizhzhia regions after holding what it called referendums in occupied areas of Ukraine. #Kyiv and Western governments said the votes breached international law and ruled them as illegitimate and non-representative.At present, Russia controls almost the entirety of Ukraine’s Luhansk region and the majority of the Donetsk region.During his speech, Lavrov once again rejected notions of Western troop deployments to Ukraine as part of security guarantees and called for the so-called -root causes- of the invasion to be addressed.-There are also people who remain there who find it more convenient to speak Russian, who want to preserve the traditions of their ancestors, who were brought up in Russian culture. Therefore, such simple mechanical things as the deployment of [foreign] troops will not do – we need to talk about the root causes,- Lavrov added.Russia has been attempting to justify its Ukraine invasion by claiming to protect Russian-speaking populations in Ukraine, a claim that is largely unfounded.At Monday’s UN General Assembly, Russia attempted to request an amendment to a UN draft resolution by adding a clause to address the so-called -root cause- of the invasion that was ultimately rejected.-Via: https://www.kyivpost.com/post/47871 ---Tees: our-wars-today.teemill.comTelegram: t.me/ourwarstoday More: linktr.ee/ourwarstoday---24/7 LIVE News RSS feed: t.me/ournewsfeedtoday

Title: 🎬🖼 🇮🇱 🇸🇾 #BREAKING Israel Builds Up Forces at Syrian Border...
Description: 🇮🇱 🇸🇾 #BREAKING Israel Builds Up Forces at Syrian Border in Golan Purportedly, Begin Bombing Campaign, Threaten to Fire On Any Forces in Southern Syria, Will -Remove Any Threat-: The IDF and #Israel's Defense Minister Katz have in the past two days, and in the past several day, alluded heavily in statements to the Israeli military looking to invade and occupy parts of southern #Syria, with the justification of clearing out militant or new #Syrian state forces. #Israeli aerial forces have now in the past hours begun airstriking, purportedly command centers of the former Syrian government and locations of weapons unspecified in ownership or type. A number of local channels in the occupied #GolanHeights have reported in the past hours that a buildup of #IDF ground forces has been ongoing, likely indicating an invasion operation is underway or at least prepared and planned if the information is true and accurate, no evidence provided yet to confirm.Following the news of recent Israeli strikes in southern Syria, an IDF spokesperson clarified that the presence of seemingly all military assets and forces in southern Syria is considered an active threat to the state of Israel and will therefore be removed with military force, although unspecified in nature as in aerial versus aerial and ground. A recent news report from Haaertz revealed that the IDF has recently built seven new military outposts in occupied Syrian territory, from the Syrian Mount Hermon to Tel Kudna.The War Blog: -This comes a day after Israeli PM Benjamin #Netanyahu threatened military action if Syrian forces moved south of Damascus to protect the Druze population.-We will not allow the forces of #HTS or the new Syrian Army to enter the area south of #Damascus,- he stated, adding that -We demand a full demilitarization of southern Syria, in the provinces of Quneitra, Daraa, and Suwayda. Likewise, we will not tolerate any threat to the Druze community in southern Syria.--Tessaron News: -At approximately 1600 EST, an explosion was reported as military aircraft fly over Damascus, Syria. Simultaneously, Israeli forces have reportedly entered northern Quneitra Governorate, Syria with military vehicles and equipment.Explosions have been reported in western Rif Dimashq Governorate as Israeli drones fly overhead in Quneitra Governorate. Israeli military aircraft have reportedly targeted al-Kiswah, south of Damascus, causing a large explosion and fire.An Israeli airstrike has also been reported in Izraa, Daraa Governorate, Syria. Israeli airstrikes have reportedly targeted former Syrian government forces’ military bases. The IDF has reportedly entered the administrative borders between Daraa and Quneitra Governorates in Syria.-Footage from local channels supposedly of Israeli airstrikes in Syria this night of February 25th. Screenshots from N12.More: https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2025-02-18/ty-article-magazine/.premium/satellite-images-reveal-seven-new-idf-outposts-in-syria-along-the-border-with-israel/00000195-17de-d0af-a197-dfdf0a4f0000https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2025-02-23/ty-article/.premium/netanyahu-israel-will-not-let-syrian-regime-forces-enter-territories-south-of-damascus/00000195-340f-d5d4-adf7-f6efa6750000---Tees: our-wars-today.teemill.comTelegram: t.me/ourwarstoday More: linktr.ee/ourwarstoday---24/7 LIVE News RSS feed: t.me/ournewsfeedtoday

Title: 🖼 🇺🇸 🇷🇺 🇺🇦 #NEW U.S. Joins Russian Federation in Vote Agai...
Description: 🇺🇸 🇷🇺 🇺🇦 #NEW U.S. Joins Russian Federation in Vote Against Condemnation of Russo-Ukrainian War, Proposes Diplomacy Over Punitive Measures For U.N. Conflict Resolution:The #UnitedNations General Assembly passed a resolution condemning #Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, with the U.S. among 18 countries opposing it. The measure, titled -Advancing a comprehensive, just and lasting peace in #Ukraine,- received 93 votes in favor and 65 abstentions, including from China. Ukraine’s European allies supported the resolution, which is non-binding but signals a shift in U.S. policy under the #Trump administration toward improving relations with Russia.⁠⁠Trump has blamed Ukrainian President Volodymyr #Zelenskiy for the war, calling him a -dictator without elections.- His administration’s diplomats have avoided directly criticizing Russian President Vladimir #Putin, widening a divide within the Republican Party. Meanwhile, the #UnitedStates introduced a competing resolution, with Secretary of State Marco Rubio stating it aligns with Trump’s view that the U.N. should focus on maintaining peace through diplomatic settlement rather than punitive resolutions.⁠⁠Ambassador Dorothy Shea, a Biden appointee, argued that past resolutions have failed to stop the war. She urged all member states, including Ukraine and Russia, to back the U.S. proposal, which she described as a -historic statement- focused on ending the conflict. The confirmation of Trump’s nominee for U.N. ambassador, Rep. Elise Stefanik, remains stalled in the Senate due to Democratic opposition to the administration’s policy shifts.⁠⁠Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24, 2022, escalating a conflict that began in 2014 with the annexation of Crimea and support for separatist forces in eastern Ukraine. The invasion triggered widespread international sanctions against Moscow and military aid to Kyiv from Western nations. ⁠–Ground News - instagran.com/groundnews---Tees: our-wars-today.teemill.comTelegram: t.me/ourwarstoday More: linktr.ee/ourwarstoday---24/7 LIVE News RSS feed: t.me/ournewsfeedtoday

Title: ↩️🖼 🇷🇺 🇺🇦 KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — #Russia launched more strike ...
Description: Our Wars, Today: Russia launches a record number of drones into Ukraine on the eve of the war's 3-year anniversary Russia has launched a record number of drones into Ukraine on the eve of the three-year anniversary of Moscow's full-scale invasion. t.me/ourwarstoday – t.m… 🇷🇺 🇺🇦 KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — #Russia launched more strike drones into #Ukraine overnight on Saturday than in any other single attack of the war, Ukrainian President #Zelenskiy said on Sunday, one day before the three-year anniversary of Moscow’s full-scale invasion.Writing on social media, Zelenskyy said 267 strike drones had been sent in what he called -the largest attack since Iranian drones began hitting Ukrainian cities and villages.- Ukraine’s air force said 138 drones had been shot down over 13 Ukrainian regions, with 119 more lost en route to their targets.Three ballistic missiles had also been fired, the air force said. One person was killed in a missile strike on the city of Kryvyi Rih, according to the head of the Kryvyi Rih military administration.The attack came as leaders in Kyiv and across Europe are seeking to navigate rapid changes in U.S. foreign policy under President Donald Trump, who in a matter of days has upended years of firm support for Ukraine, leading to fears that he would join with Moscow to force a settlement to the war without involving Ukraine and its European backers.Ukraine fears Trump’s policy shift toward Putin:#Trump’s engagement with Russian officials and his agreement to reopen diplomatic ties and economic cooperation with Moscow marked a dramatic about-face in U.S. policy which had previously sought to isolate Russia and its president, Vladimir #Putin, over the war.Zelenskyy has expressed fears that Trump pushing a quick resolution would result in lost territory for Ukraine and vulnerability to future Russian aggression, though U.S. officials have asserted that the Ukrainian leader would be involved if and when peace talks actually start.Trump, however, prompted alarm and anger in Ukraine when this week he suggested that Kyiv had started the war, and that Zelenskyy was acting as a -dictator- since the country has not held elections in accordance with Ukrainian legislation prohibiting them during martial law.Russia’s deputy foreign minister on Saturday said preparations were underway for a Trump-Putin meeting, a further sign that the Russian leader’s isolation, at least for the Trump administration, was beginning to thaw.Reacting to the latest Russian attacks, however, Andrii Sybiha‎, Ukraine’s Minister of Foreign Affairs, said that the overnight strikes against civilian and military targets -demonstrates that avoiding calling Russia an aggressor does not change the fact that it is one.--No one should trust Putin’s words. Look at his actions instead,- Sybiha‎ said in a statement on social media.Putin praises soldiers fighting in Ukraine:Zelenskyy and other officials will participate in a forum in Kyiv on Sunday where they will discuss the state of the country a day before the war reaches its three-year mark. Zelenskyy will conclude the forum with a news conference.The forum comes at a sensitive moment for Kyiv as Trump’s administration pushes Ukraine’s leaders to agree to a deal that would allow the U.S. to access Ukrainian rare earth minerals, a proposal Zelenskyy earlier declined to accept because it lacked specific security guarantees.-We must do our utmost to bring a lasting and just peace to Ukraine,- Zelenskyy wrote on social media on Sunday. -This is possible with the unity of all partners — we need the strength of all of Europe, the strength of America, the strength of all who want a reliable peace.-Meanwhile, Putin in a special televised message Sunday praised Russian soldiers fighting in Ukraine for defending -their native land, the national interests and the future of Russia.-Putin’s speech marked Russia’s Defender of the Fatherland Day, which falls a day before the anniversary of the invasion of Ukraine. He used the holiday greeting to pledge greater social support for military personnel and new weapons and equipment for Russian forces.–APRead more: https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-war-drones-anniversary-putin-trump-c8f73a98d071055be52a1b22b0785ecc---Telegram: t.me/ourwarstoday ---24/7 LIVE News RSS feed: t.me/ournewsfeedtoday

Title: 🔁🖼 The leaders of France and Britain head to Washington to urge...
Description: Forwarded From Our News, TodayThe leaders of France and Britain head to Washington to urge Trump not to abandon UkraineThe leaders of France and Britain are making tag-team visits to Washington this week. It's part of European efforts to persuade President Donald Trump not to abandon Ukraine in pursuit of a peace deal in the three-year-old war with Russia. t.me/ourwarstoday – t.me/ournewsfeedtodayJill Lawless,Sylvie Corbet | apnews.com • Feb 23, 2025
